sentences.sContent: The match had to be postponed until next week.
sentences.sCn: 比赛不得不推迟到下周举行。

sentences.sContent: His trial has been postponed indefinitely (= no one knows when it will happen ) .
sentences.sCn: 对他的审判被无限期推迟了。

sentences.sContent: ...but Millennials seem to be extending this phase of life　as they postpone marriage...

synos.tran: 使…延期；把…放在次要地位；把…放在后面

remMethod.val: post(在后面) ＋ pone(放) → 放到后面 → 延迟

trans.tranOther: to change the date or time of a planned event or action to a later one
